subSections.title: Glyph origin
subSections.text: Unorthodox variant {{Han simp|樂|nocap=y}} ({{l|zh|𢆶}} → ⿱{{l|zh|[[丷]][[八]]}}) found in the Ming dynasty orthographic dictionary <big>《字學三正》</big>.<!-- Refer http://dict.variants.moe.edu.tw/variants/rbt/word_attribute.rbt?quote_code=QTAyMDE2LTAwMw#33 --> Also found in 《{{w2|zh|宋元以來俗字譜}}》, a {{w|Variant Chinese character|variant forms}} dictionary compiled in 1930 that records unorthodox forms ({{l|zh|俗字}}) that have existed since the {{w|Song dynasty}}.

Etymology 3
subSections.text:
{{ja-kanjitab|このみ|yomi=k}}

Nominalization of the {{m|ja|連用形|tr=ren'yōkei||stem or continuative form}} of {{m|ja|好む|tr=konomu||to [[like]], [[prefer]]}}.
